In the description of the challenge we can see that the program was written in the Lazarus language, this means that we wonâ€™t be able to determine what is happening by using the classic c/c++ function calls. The lazarus language is easy to understand when decompiled though. There are a few function calls that setup the input and output. Before the first conditional statement we can find a call to â€œFPC_ANSISTR_COMPARE_EQUALâ€ which compares the value that we gave to the second argument. The second argument is stored in plaintext and is â€œ11111â€. Giving â€œ11111â€ as input will give us a success message.
